tr.td: The counts are the number of GOs having changes, NOT the number of changes themselves. For example, a given GO can have several note changes and yet these changes increase the Notes count by only one. Thus the number of actual note changes is greater than or equal to the value given in the Notes count. The same is true for Consonants, Vowels, Accents, and Morphological Divisions.
